alert.note: Alert for Russell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 12:58AM EDT until July 28 at 5:45AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Norton, Russell and Wise. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1257 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area during the next couple hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Norton, Wise, Cleveland Va, Coeburn, Honaker, Pound, St. Paul, Castlewood, Rosedale and Dye. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
